reqs:
Students who have received credit for CLST 331 (a six-credit course titled 'Ancient History' which was taught last in 2008) of may not receive credit also for either CLST 231 or CLST 232 (because the old CLST 331 Ancient History was simply divided into two three-credit courses, CLST 231 and 232, i.e., it had the same content as 231 and 232). This rule does not concern the new CLST 331 (first taught in
2014) 'Greek Art and Architecture', which is a completely different course than the old CLST 331. If you are unsure about registration in any of these courses, please do not hesitate to contact the undergraduate advisor of CNERS, Dr. Lyn Rae (lyn.rae@ubc.ca).
description: A survey of the ancient Greek world from the Minoan and Mycenaean (about 2000-1000 BCE) to the Hellenistic Period (323-30 BCE).
